com.mousebird.maply
Class MarkerInfo

java.lang.Object
  com.mousebird.maply.MarkerInfo

public class MarkerInfo
extends java.lang.Object

This class holds the visual information for a set of 2D or 3D markers. Rather than have each of those represent their own visual information, we share it here.

Toolkit users fill this class out and pass it into the addScreenMarkers() or addMarkers() call on the MaplyController.

Author:
sjg

Method Detail

finalize

public void finalize()
Overrides:
finalize in class java.lang.Object

setEnable

public void setEnable(boolean enable)
Create markers enabled or disabled. The enable can be changed later.

setDrawOffset

public void setDrawOffset(float drawOffset)
Set the drawOffset for a marker. This is rarely used.

setDrawPriority

public void setDrawPriority(int drawPriority)
Set the drawPriority for a marker. Draw priority controls the order in which features are drawn. For screen markers, drawPriority controls what order markers are drawn with respect to other screen objects, like labels, but not 3D objects like stickers or vectors.

setMinVis

public void setMinVis(float minVis)
Set the minimum cutoff for visibility of the markers. This is the closest height the markers will be visible from. Defaults to 0.0 (always visible).

setMaxVis

public void setMaxVis(float maxVis)
Set the maximum cutoff for visibility of the markers. This is the biggest height the markers will be visible from. Defaults to off.

setColor

public void setColor(float r,
                     float g,
                     float b,
                     float a)
Set the background color for the markers. If the marker has a texture, this will be multiplied with the texture. Color components range from 0.0 to 1.0.

Parameters:
r - red
g - green
b - blue
a - alpha

setFade

public void setFade(float fade)
The amount of time (in seconds) it takes for new geometry to fade in and fade out. By default, fade is off.
